intro: Tropaeolum fintelmannii, commonly known as the golden groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Tropaeolaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers and edible, peppery fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of about 30 to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branching. Tropaeolum fintelmannii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental and edible gardens.
